===Etymology===
Probably from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=きんぎんか}}. Literally “gold silver flower”. Compare modern {{etyl|zh|-}} simplified {{m|zh|金银花}} and traditional {{m|zh|金銀花|tr=jīnyínhuā}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===

* {{ja-accent-common|n|き|んぎ|んか}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[kĩŋɡĩŋka̠]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|きんぎんか}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=きんぎんか|rare}} the {{vern|Japanese honeysuckle}} [[plant]], ''[[Lonicera japonica]]''.
# the [[flower]] of the {{vern|Japanese honeysuckle}}

====Usage notes====
More commonly called {{ja-l|スイカズラ||suikazura}} in Japanese.<ref name="KDJ"/><ref name="DJR"/>
